entries.meaning: (historical) A camera that could develop its own film and served as its own projector.
examples: “Oh, you mean the cinematograph—the pictures of prize-fights and steamers. I’ve seen ’em up country.”
“Biograph or cinematograph was what I was alludin’ to. London Bridge with the omnibuses—a troopship goin’ to the war—marines on parade at Portsmouth an’ the Plymouth Express arrivin’ at Paddin’ton.”
“Seen ’em all. Seen ’em all,” said Hooper impatiently.

verbs.description: cinematograph (third-person singular simple present cinematographs, present participle cinematographing, simple past and past participle cinematographed)

entries.meaning: (rare) To employ the techniques of cinematography.
